cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 235 mi east of Cabo Gracias a Dios on the Nicaragua/Honduras border
cyclone.trajectory: Turning northwest, expected to cross the Yucatan Peninsula Saturday night and then track northwest across the south-central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-central Gulf Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana coast (near the mouth of the Mississippi River–Morgan City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Honduras/Nicaragua border westward to Punta Castilla, including the Bay Islands of Honduras
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-west Caribbean, Yucatan Peninsula, and north-central Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana border eastward to Mississippi/Alabama coast
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds possible Monday night into Tuesday with a 15% peak probability of sustained 34-kt winds; 50-kt winds only a 3% chance.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding possible but surge heights currently forecast below 3 ft along the Upper Texas Coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain-bands could bring roughly 1–3 inches of rain to Galveston Monday–Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and short-period swells in the approaches to Galveston Ship Channel beginning late Monday.
